Italy: Postumus was killed by his soldiers, who in turn acclaimed one of their own, Marcus Aurelius Marius, emperor of the Gallic Empire. Marius was murdered by Victorinus, formerly prefect of Postumus's Praetorian Guard, who replaced him as emperor of the Gallic Empire. Zenobia conquered Egypt. Battle of Naissus: Roman forces decisively defeated the Goths at modern Ni≈°, stalling an invasion of the Balkans.
